title: References
text:
Dı́az, Iván. 2020. “Machine Learning in the Estimation of Causal Effects: Targeted Minimum Loss-Based Estimation and Double/Debiased Machine Learning.” Biostatistics 21 (2): 353–58. https://doi.org/10.1093/biostatistics/kxz042.


Fisher, Aaron, and Edward H Kennedy. 2020. “Visually Communicating and Teaching Intuition for Influence Functions.” The American Statistician 75 (2): 162–72. https://doi.org/10.1080/00031305.2020.1717620.


Henmi, Masayuki, and Shinto Eguchi. 2004. “A Paradox Concerning Nuisance Parameters and Projected Estimating Functions.” Biometrika 91 (4): 929–41. https://doi.org/10.1093/biomet/91.4.929.


Hernán, Miguel A, and James M Robins. 2024. Causal Inference: What If. CRC Press.


Hines, Oliver, Oliver Dukes, Karla Diaz-Ordaz, and Stijn Vansteelandt. 2022. “Demystifying Statistical Learning Based on Efficient Influence Functions.” The American Statistician 76 (3): 292–304. https://doi.org/10.1080/00031305.2021.2021984.


Kennedy, Edward H. 2016. “Semiparametric Theory and Empirical Processes in Causal Inference.” In Statistical Causal Inferences and Their Applications in Public Health Research, edited by Hua He, Pan Wu, and Ding-Geng (Din) Chen, 141–67. Springer. https://doi.org/10.1007/978-3-319-41259-7_8.


———. 2022. “Semiparametric Doubly Robust Targeted Double Machine Learning: A Review.” arXiv Preprint arXiv:2203.06469. https://doi.org/10.48550/arXiv.2203.06469.


Kosorok, Michael R. 2008. Introduction to Empirical Processes and Semiparametric Inference. Springer. https://doi.org/10.1007/978-0-387-74978-5.


Rytgaard, Helene Charlotte. 2020. “Targeted Causal Learning for Longitudinal Data.” PhD thesis, University of Copenhagen. https://biostat.ku.dk/dissertations/2020_rytgaard.pdf.


Tsiatis, Anastasios. 2007. Semiparametric Theory and Missing Data. Springer. https://doi.org/10.1007/0-387-37345-4.


van der Laan, Mark J, and James M Robins. 2003. Unified Methods for Censored Longitudinal Data and Causality. Springer. https://doi.org/10.1007/978-0-387-21700-0.


van der Laan, Mark J, and Sherri Rose. 2011. Targeted Learning: Causal Inference for Observational and Experimental Data. Springer. https://doi.org/10.1007/978-1-4419-9782-1.


———. 2018. Targeted Learning in Data Science: Causal Inference for Complex Longitudinal Studies. Springer. https://doi.org/10.1007/978-3-319-65304-4.


Ying, Andrew. 2024. “A Geometric Perspective on Double Robustness by Semiparametric Theory and Information Geometry.” arXiv Preprint arXiv:2404.13960. https://arxiv.org/abs/2404.13960.

title: NSH Lab Calendar
text:
All meetings are on Mondays 2-3pm ET and will be held in person only in HSPH 2-426.

Topic
Paper
Presenter

21st October (Week 3)
Building blocks of longitudinal causal inference
